Compare Scots yisterday, yesterday (â€œyesterdayâ€), Gothic ğŒ²ğŒ¹ğƒğ„ğ‚ğŒ°ğŒ³ğŒ°ğŒ²ğŒ¹ğƒ (gistradagis, â€œtomorrowâ€, adverb). Compare further Dutch gisteren, German gestern.

examples: I started to watch the video yesterday, but could only finish it this evening.

entries.meaning: The day immediately before today; one day ago.
examples: Today is the child of yesterday and the parent of tomorrow.
Yesterday was rainy, but by this morning it had begun to snow.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) The past, often in terms of being outdated.
examples: The worker of today is different from that of yesterday.
